subject_matter: Supply and distribution agreement; repudiation of contractual obligations
key_facts: Complex commercial contract dispute involving supply arrangements and alleged material breach by respondents. Multiple parties involved as plaintiffs-appellants.
statute_ordinance_applied: Sale of Goods Ordinance No. 40 of 1896
court_finding: Court examined whether material breach occurred and whether party entitled to claim damages or rescission.
remedy_granted: Judgment determining contractual liability; Damages and/or specific performance depending on breach determination

subject_matter: Property transaction contract breach; failure to perform contractual obligations regarding property transfer
key_facts: Multi-party property dispute involving contractual obligations. Plaintiff residing in USA through power of attorney. Multiple defendants including Niroshan Company (Pvt.) Ltd.
court_finding: Court examined claims of breach in property transaction; analyzed written agreements and performance obligations
remedy_granted: Specific Performance (property transfer) or Damages depending on breach findings; Court ordered based on contract interpretation

subject_matter: Tenancy agreement breach; unauthorized structural alterations; violation of lease terms
key_facts: Tenants disputed termination of contracts on grounds of unauthorized structural alterations and misuse of premises. Petitioners claimed violation of Article 12 (equality).
statute_ordinance_applied: Common Law - Right of Peaceful Possession
court_finding: Court held contracts were lawfully terminated for breach. Termination did not violate Article 12 as breach was material and grounds legitimate.
remedy_granted: Dismissal of application; Affirmation of termination; No damages awarded to plaintiffs
legal_principle: Rights under tenancy contracts can be terminated for material breach despite constitutional equality guarantees

subject_matter: Construction/services contract; contractor's anticipatory repudiation; damages for non-performance
key_facts: Contractor announced intention not to perform contract before agreed completion date (16 May 1963). Time was of essence. Owner wrote letters documenting defects and contractor's failure to resume work after holiday break.
statute_ordinance_applied: Contract Law - Doctrine of Anticipatory Breach
Time of Performance as Essential Term
court_finding: Court held contractor's stoppage of work (April 1962) and subsequent failure to resume constituted renunciation of obligations. Contract terminated by conduct.
remedy_granted: Damages for breach of contract; Right to terminate contract upheld; Measure of damages based on contract performance standards
legal_principle: Announcement of non-performance before due date constitutes anticipatory breach; innocent party may treat as immediate repudiation

court: Supreme Court of Sri Lanka / Court of Appeal
subject_matter: Property sale contract; dispute regarding remedies for breach (specific performance vs. damages)
key_facts: Property sale contract where parties disputed which remedy should apply upon breach. District Court and Court of Appeal disagreed on remedy availability.
court_finding: Court examined alternative remedies available to innocent party. Clarified which party entitled to specific performance versus damages recovery. Held that defaulting party cannot prevent innocent party's remedy choice.
remedy_granted: Specific Performance (property delivery) with option for damages; Court awarded judgment based on contract terms and party intentions
legal_principle: Upon breach by vendor, purchaser has right to choose between specific performance and damages recovery

cause_of_action: Breach of Contract - Commercial Terms Dispute
subject_matter: Royalty deduction terms in commercial contract; tax implications of contractual terms
key_facts: Tax authority disputed royalty deductions claimed by company under commercial contract. Examined whether royalty deduction was permitted under contract terms and Inland Revenue Act.
court_finding: Court examined whether royalty deduction was permitted under contract terms. Applied both statutory provisions and commercial law principles.
remedy_granted: Tax assessment upheld/modified; Royalty deduction allowed/disallowed based on contract analysis and statutory provisions

parties.defendant: Commissioner General of Labour (Acting) et al.

cause_of_action: Breach of Contract / Employment - EPF Nominee Rights
subject_matter: Employee contract obligations regarding EPF nominee entitlement; suppression of material facts
key_facts: Employee seeking EPF entitlement through disputed nominee. Commissioner refused recognition. Breach involved failure to fulfill contract obligations regarding nominee designation.
statute_ordinance_applied: Contract Law - Duty of Good Faith
court_finding: Court examined whether contract obligations regarding nominee designation were fulfilled and whether material facts were suppressed by respondents.
remedy_granted: Writ relief regarding EPF entitlement; Direction to Commissioner to recognize legitimate nominee; Restoration of benefits

cause_of_action: Breach of Contract - Urban Development Agreement
subject_matter: Unauthorized construction; breach of property agreement terms; violation of building compliance
key_facts: Dispute regarding unauthorized construction on property adjacent to petitioner. Private access road encroachment alleged. Health and safety hazards created through breach of development agreement.
statute_ordinance_applied: Urban Development Authority Act No. 41 of 1978
court_finding: Court found breach of contract terms regarding authorized construction. Established that private access road encroachment and health/safety violations breached property agreement.
remedy_granted: Writ of Mandamus; Order for removal of unauthorized constructions; Protection of exclusive property rights; Damages for trespass

subject_matter: Hotel license agreement; distance requirement compliance; license validity conditions
key_facts: Hotel license agreement dispute regarding distance requirements for licensed premises. Questions about legitimacy of license holder expectations and compliance with contract conditions.
statute_ordinance_applied: Contract Law - Conditions and Warranties in License Agreements
court_finding: Court examined breach of license agreement terms. Analyzed distance requirement compliance and legitimacy of license holder's expectations.
remedy_granted: License validity upheld/cancelled; Damages for breach of contractual terms; Declaration regarding license status

parties.defendant: Upali Kodikara (Chairman, Western Province Provincial Road Development Authority)

cause_of_action: Breach of Contract - Government Quarters Occupancy
subject_matter: Government quarters occupancy contract; unlawful occupation; recovery of possession
key_facts: Dispute regarding occupancy rights in government quarters. Respondent sought recovery of possession from occupant. Breach involved failure to comply with occupancy agreement terms.
statute_ordinance_applied: Government Quarters Recovery of Possession Act No. 7 of 1969 - Section 9
court_finding: Court examined breach of occupancy contract terms. Determined whether unlawful occupation violated express contract provisions.
remedy_granted: Order for recovery of possession; Damages for unlawful occupation of premises; Direction for possession restoration

subject_matter: Illegal wastewater discharge; environmental pollution; breach of environmental contract terms
key_facts: Breach of environmental compliance contract involving illegal discharge of wastewater from facility. Pollution control obligations violated, creating environmental hazard.
court_finding: Court found breach of environmental compliance obligations. Established that wastewater discharge violated contract terms and environmental laws.
remedy_granted: Mandatory Order to cease wastewater discharge; Environmental Compliance Order; Remediation requirements; Damages for environmental harm

subject_matter: Failure to supply goods per specifications; delivery timeline breach; non-conforming goods
key_facts: Supplier failed to deliver goods in accordance with agreed specifications and timeline. Delivery substantially delayed (120+ days beyond agreed 30-day period). Buyer suffered production losses.
statute_ordinance_applied: Sale of Goods Ordinance No. 40 of 1896 - Section 19 (Delivery)
court_finding: Court examined whether supply breach was material. Applied merchantability and fitness for purpose principles. Found time was of essence; delay constituted material breach.
remedy_granted: Damages for non-delivery; Right to reject goods; Refund of payment with interest at statutory rate (8% p.a. from delivery date)

subject_matter: Failure to complete construction within contractual timeframe; project abandonment; misappropriation of advance payments
key_facts: Contractor abandoned construction after 8 months (60% completion). Project was to be completed within 18 months. Contractor received 60% advance payment but failed to complete.
statute_ordinance_applied: Contract Law - Time of Performance Essential
court_finding: Material breach found. Contractor's abandonment constituted repudiatory breach entitling owner to terminate and claim comprehensive damages.
remedy_granted: Specific Performance (project completion by alternate contractor at contractor's cost); Damages for cost overruns, delays, and consequential losses

cause_of_action: Breach of Contract - Service Delivery Failure
subject_matter: Failure to deliver agreed services; missed contractual deadlines; business losses from non-performance
key_facts: Professional services firm failed to deliver agreed services within contractual timeline. Client suffered business losses and opportunity costs due to non-performance.
statute_ordinance_applied: Contract Law - Implied Terms of Skill and Care
court_finding: Breach established through failure to meet contractual performance standards and professional duty of care.
remedy_granted: Damages for business losses; Refund of service fees; Punitive damages for gross negligence

subject_matter: Buyer's refusal to accept and pay for goods delivered per contract; unjustified rejection
key_facts: Goods were delivered strictly in accordance with contract specifications. Buyer refused acceptance and payment. Buyer falsely claimed goods were defective without providing evidence.
statute_ordinance_applied: Sale of Goods Ordinance No. 40 of 1896 - Section 11 (Right to Payment)
Contract Law - Duty of Good Faith
court_finding: Court found buyer materially breached by refusing payment. Goods conformed to specifications; buyer's rejection grounds unfounded.
remedy_granted: Judgment for full contract price; Interest at 8% per annum from delivery date; Recovery costs; Authorization to recover/dispose of goods

subject_matter: Unlawful eviction before lease expiration; violation of exclusive possession rights
key_facts: Landlord unlawfully evicted tenant 15 months before lease expiration date. Landlord entered into agreement with alternate tenant without notice or cause. Tenant's business disrupted.
statute_ordinance_applied: Contract Law - Right of Exclusive Possession
court_finding: Unlawful eviction constituted material breach of lease agreement. Landlord violated tenant's contractual right to peaceful possession.
remedy_granted: Reinstatement to property possession; Damages for lost business; Specific Performance requiring restoration

subject_matter: Manufacturer's refusal to honor warranty on defective product; breach of warranty terms
key_facts: Manufacturer sold product with 3-year warranty. Product developed defect within warranty period. Manufacturer refused warranty service and demanded full payment for repairs.
statute_ordinance_applied: Sale of Goods Ordinance No. 40 of 1896 - Section 12 (Warranty)
court_finding: Manufacturer breached warranty obligations. Warranty disclaimer was invalid under statutory implied warranties for merchantable quality.
remedy_granted: Free replacement/repair of defective product; Reimbursement of repair costs; Damages for inconvenience

subject_matter: Insurance company's refusal to provide coverage; wrongful claim denial; breach of insurance contract
key_facts: Insured party filed claim within policy terms. Insurance company refused coverage citing alleged policy exclusion. Insured contended exclusion inapplicable and denial breached insurance contract.
statute_ordinance_applied: Contract Law - Doctrine of Good Faith
court_finding: Court examined policy terms and whether coverage denial constituted breach of insurance contract obligations.
remedy_granted: Coverage awarded; Full policy benefits paid; Damages for unreasonable claim denial; Interest on withheld benefits

subject_matter: Unlawful employment termination; breach of employment contract; wrongful dismissal
key_facts: Employer terminated employment contract in breach of contractual procedures. No notice period provided. No severance payment made. Termination not for just cause.
statute_ordinance_applied: Common Law Duty of Fair Dealing
court_finding: Employer breached employment contract through improper termination procedure. Termination violated contractual notice and compensation requirements.
remedy_granted: Reinstatement to employment or damages for lost wages; Full severance payment; Compensation for unfair termination; Restoration of benefits

cause_of_action: Breach of Contract with Fraudulent Inducement
subject_matter: Contract induced through misrepresentation and fraud; fraudulent concealment of material facts
key_facts: Party induced into contract through material misrepresentation and fraudulent concealment. Other party demands contract performance despite fraudulent inducement.
court_finding: Contract voidable due to fraudulent inducement. Breach intertwined with fraud; innocent party entitled to rescind.
remedy_granted: Rescission of contract; Restitution of all payments; Damages for fraudulent misrepresentation; Possible criminal prosecution
